text:
When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima á
with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.

When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had á
not expected to do so well.

When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost in á
an unfamiliar environment.  It was getting dark and we did not á
know how to get back home.

When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus á
holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt á
angry over his actions.

When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from á
what I was told about it.

When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just off á
Kafue.  The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and        á
splinters of bone every where.
When I was accepted at UNZA.

When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard á
gunshots.

When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  á
A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see á
him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.

When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a á
murder).

When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so á
bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized á
how bad it was.
Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.

When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary á
school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.  á
The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel á
us.

At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.  á
When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my á
inability to find out my enemies.  I lost my temper.
When my grandfather died.

My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face á
down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he á
fainted and so I called the first aid.

I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.  á
I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.

I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and á
threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money. á
 I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.

A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to á
marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not á
leave her alone.

When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to á
rest.
When I witnessed an accident.
When I won some coins in a small competion.

I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights á
were off.  I got inside the gate and just then I realized that á
the dogs may be outside.

My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very á
naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.

This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was á
attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate á
woke me up.
When I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.
When I was selected for the university.

When I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the á
spot.

When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my á
wardrobe.
When my grandmother passed away.

While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting á
helplessly.

When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a á
long time.
When I was told that the form five results were out.

When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not á
know.

The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the á
Zambia closed badminton championships.

When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have taken á
her time.
When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.

When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be á
forced to marry her or go to court.

When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given á
me.

When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation á
and they are together now).

When I patronized a certain tavern which had prostitutes, it was á
almost a brothel.

When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever á
cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to á
learn that it was me who was delaying things.

Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them á
would be killed.
When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead á
mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

I feel disgusted at not having got aa "A" in yesterday's á
practicals of G220.

Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her á
abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our á
suprise she had a baby 2 months back.

My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer.  á
There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4 á
operated.  I was scared for my uncle's life.

I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she á
went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It á
was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who á
had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we á
went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.

I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I á
was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my á
friend.  That day I was really sad.

I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my á
brother came home he ate it all.  I was really disgusted about it.

I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA á
was approved after it had been cancelled.
When I met an elephant in the bush.
When someone took my pen away.

When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell á
ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.

An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give á
me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.
When I was with someone I love.
When I was walking around all alone at night.
Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
When my dad passed away.
When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.
At my sister's wedding.
When I had to walk along a dark road alone.
When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.

When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of á
Zambia.
When I found out that someone close to me was flirting around.

When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my á
lover and future wife.

When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be á
heard.
When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.

The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my á
grade six.

When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I á
had learnt all the lines.

I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last á
born in the family.

My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I á
was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay á
unconscious in hospital for two weeks.

I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of the á
transport money I had to go to school.

I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and á
she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.

I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I á
had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.
When I was selected to study here at UNZA.

In 1960,  I was going to a school which was near my village and I á
met a lion on the way, which disappeared suddenly.
When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.
When I heard of the death of my mother.

When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them á
financially.

I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter á
to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year á
courses.

In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile.  We were á
swimming in a river on whose banks our primary school was á
situated.  When my friend was caught, he was on the banks of the á
river and some of us were still in the middle of the river.  I á
was very frightened.

In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating á
up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible á
for his guardian's failure.

Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had á
passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the         á
biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.

Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in á
a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.  á
He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.

When I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who á
qualified for form I that year.

When I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in hospital and á
was on the verge of dying as she had refused to accept the á
responsibility of her pregnancy and had wanted to commit suicide.

When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been á
disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  á
days earlier.

When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the á
death of my father.

When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the á
rooms were allotted to first year students who were from "Rucher" á
and came from influential families.
When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.

When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and á
ordered me to give them money or face death.
When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.
When my elder brother died.
When my friend, after a beer spree vomitted in my sitting room.
When my brother gave me a watch.
Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.
When the girl I loved turned me down.
When I found my girl in bed with another man.

When I passed the first year and so I could come back for my á
second year.

I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad á
would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started á
getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very, á
very far away.

One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had á
objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced á
me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him á
for over an hour.

When my grandmother passed away.  We had been waiting for it as á
she had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hard á
to accept.

When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a á
very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling á
false stories about us to other people.

I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying á
colours and that I had made it to the university.

Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were á
trying to kiss me.

One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I á
was sure that I had done no such thing.
The passing away of my mum.

One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab á
his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.
The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his á
permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.
When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.

When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a á
car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my á
form five exams with flying colours.
When I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.

When my sister's first child came home, after one week in á
intensive care at the hospital.

When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian á
soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the á
whole scene.

A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical á
school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been á
left out.  Biased judgment !

My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then á
the older one died a week later.

When I went to report a stolen good at the police station, the á
woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have á
respect for anyone.
When I met my mother after not having seen her for three years.

When my neighbour's life was threatened by someone who was trying á
to break into his house.

When a boy who was drunk came into my room and misbehaved in the á
presence of my boyfriend.

My father resigned from work, and soon after this his elder brother á
died.  The next day my granny died (my mother's mother).  My dad á
remains the only living member of his family.

When the committee, to which I belong, was accused of having á
squandered the money of the association.

For my parents anniversary, we hosted a party and we were very á
happy.

One evening when my sisters, brothers and I were watching T.V my á
kid brother took a big mirror and reflected light on the french á
windows.  I thought that these lights that we could see were á
coming from torches annd that it meant that there were thieves á
outside.

Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were not á
really true.
A break-up with someone I really liked.

I came across a woman in town who was very drunk.  She was á
swearing at everyone and carried on drinking even though she á
could hardly stand.
When I accepted Jesus Christ as my personal saviour.

When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers, á
 nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road.á

When my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed my á
parents.
When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.
When I failed the  grade 7 exams.
When I attended my cousin's 31st birthday.

I got a very nasty electrical shock when I was tampering with á
some electrical applainces.á
When I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.

When I received my results and found out that I could not go to a á
school of my choice.

When I found a maggot in my food at the dinning hall, all the á
food had gone bad.
When I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).
When I thought that I had failed the examination.

When I discovered that my girlfriend was going around with á
another boy.
When my grandfather died.

When I heard that my sister had shouted at my friend's cousin at á
their place.

When my girl told me that she loved me more than any male á
creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart á
for all her life.

The day I was nearly stabbed to death by ruffians who wanted to á
take my money.  I refused to give them any money and they started á
running after me, I ran into somebody else's house to save á
myself.

When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he á
had just repaired.

When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and á
that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange á
for the ones I had given her.

When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had á
actually refused me.  When I confronted her she started insulting á
me.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at UNZA.

When thieves broke into my house at night and held my wife and me á
on gun-point for at least ten minutes and took away a lot of á
property.

When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine á
as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part á
with a few coins for their drinks.

When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I á
depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of á
their daughter's buisness.

When my younger sister visited me during the school holidays and á
told me that she would not go back to school because she was á
pregnant.

When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just á
come home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppe á
which I opened and was overcome with joy.

I was at home and we were sleeping when we heard some robbers á
breaking into our house.

A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was á
not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.  á
I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

My elder sister whom I love very much was leaving for the          á
West Indies for two years and I was staying behind.

A certain girl asked me what my major was and when I told her á
that it was P.A she started criticizing it saying, "I hate that á
course."  She just shows off in front of other people.

When I was selected to this university despite my having á
studyied in difficulty throughout my secondary school days.

I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade á
eight.

I was afraid when I learnt that my father was seriously ill in á
hospital.
When I met my new girlfriend with another man in the street.

When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his á
friends and that he was dead.

When I found out that the seat in the coach that I had booked had á
been sold to somebody else.
My son passed grade 7 and was accepted for form I.
When the robbers broke in, at night.

I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with á
whom I had previously discussed the assignment.
When I got a message that my child was not feeling well.

When I was teaching a student started making silly remarks in á
class.

When I received the acceptance form for the second year at á
university.

The day my parents were involved in a car accident and had to be á
operated  and before the operation the doctor said that it was á
mater of life or death.

I got into an argument with a photographer for whom I had to pose á
twelve times, over  a period of four weeks, before I could get a á
snap of mine.  Every time the film was processed my snap did not á
come out although the others did.

I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZA á
demonstrations.

I was disgusted at the way the bus conductor threw out an old á
woman oiut of the mini-bus simply because she could not pay the á
fare for her luggage.

This last August when my parents dropped me off and moved me into á
college I didn't know anybody here; I was 17 and Berkeley really á
scared me.

When I found my boyfriend, who I had been dating for a year, at á
another girl's house. We had had previous conflicts concerning á
the girl, but he had always claimed they were just friends.

The same as for SHAME and DISGUST. I was asked to resign my á
sorority which I did because I was ashamed.
The same as in SHAME.
Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.
Whenever I think of enrolling in Organic Chemistry.

I saw in a movie a block on which affluence and poverty existed. á
I saw that the rich made no attempts to help the poor.

When I felt powerless to help the poor or when I don't know how á
to.

I felt disgusted at my teams poor perfomance prior to league á
play.

I received a grade above average on a midterm (chemistry) and I á
expected onevery below average.

I was walking home from a place on southside and I live on á
Northside and I was followed. I headed my most direct route.

Someone signed up for a workshift at the co-op where I live and á
she did not want to work the switchboard. I became very angry. á
She had mentioned earlier that she wanted and needed the á
workshift to me so I did not sign up.

I did not do as well as I expected on a chemistry exam. I á
received a score below the average and I thought I had done very á
well.

I saw someone that I thought I knew repeatedly drunk. I do not á
like to be around alcoholics.

Right before I went to a concert with my last boyfriend he told á
me that although he told me he was going to take me to the á
concert, he didn't want to see me anymore. After that we stayed á
overnight and I said "well, when he leaves me I will be ruined á
for awhile, but for now we're together." I woke up in his arms á
and it was the happiest moment of my life.

I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I was á
sucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could think á
was that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the water á
it seemed like no one would care or remember.

One of my first boyfriends got mad at me because a lot of my á
close friends were guys and he didn't want me to see them anymore á
because he was jealous.

I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I á
realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never á
see eachother again and none of it mattered.

I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was, á
and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to á
please God. I could never understand how something that brings you á
joy could be a sin.
I felt extreme joy the day I was baptized. I was one with God.

I felt fear when my friend and I broke into an abandoned military á
base in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't want á
to be caught.

I experienced anger most recently when I had committed a sin á
which I had gone a week and a half without doing. I had made a á
vow to God and had blown it. Now I had to start all over.

I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my á
long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.

When I committed a sin mentioned in ANGER. A sin of sexual á
immorality.
Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.

A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left á
some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My á
uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that á
we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.

When I took the B.A exams,I was expecting a 1st class even though á
I had not done very well. When the results came out I felt sad as á
I had missed the 1st class by 12 marks.

A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does á
not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me á
by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with á
both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and á
would like me to be close only to her.

When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on á
my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.
I was scared of water when I was a child.
When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.
When my aunt died.

A friend of mine remembered me when she needed me and did not á
even think about me when she did not need me.

When I passed the B.A exams with 1st class.  I was the first in á
the family to have got a 1st class, so all the family members á
were very happy and they gave me the opportunity to study á
further.

When I dreamt that my family was in trouble and was facing many á
difficulties.

When my brother got very low marks in the exams, I was very angry. á
I put my studies aside to help him, as every time my brother does  á
badly at school, my family members blame me as well.á
á

[ When family mmembers or friends blame me for something I am not á
responsible for.  I feel very sad as it was not my fault.]

[ I feel disgust at people lying.  It means that they say one á
thing to one person and the same thing in another way to another á
person and this makes people quarrel among themselves.]

When last year in college I received the award "Best Student of the Year", á
  I felt very happy as I got what I had wanted and my wish had á
been fulfilled.á

Once I woke up in the middle of the night and felt frightened as á
everyone else was sleeping and I could not even go to their á
room.

[ It irritates me when people talk about me behind my back.  I    á
prefer people to tell me what they have to, on my face instead á
of talking behind my back.]
[ When friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]

At work when I did not get the full co-operation of my colleagues á
to complete an assignment.

In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small á
picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and á
cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had á
for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.

Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me to á
surrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.

One night we, all the family members, were sitting in the front á
corridor of the house when a gentleman looking person came in.  á
He was my father's client and he had come to bribe my father in á
connection with the proceeding case.  At my father's refusal he á
abused my father, my brother and I could not control our temper á
and we rushed at him.

Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very á
controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed á
with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So á
I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very á
sad about this.

After joining my M.A in Social Sciences, I appeared for the first á
semester exam.  I failed one of the exams, and when I looked at á
my results I felt disgusted and then I got angry.

I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my á
birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.

When I lost a wallet while travelling, since it belonged to the á
group I was very afraid.

When a person whom I had invited did not come on the appointed á
day and time.

I tried my level best to care for my client, I took an á
appointment with a doctor and before meeting the doctor he á
expired - a poor small boy from Uttar Pradesh.

My notes were not returned to me, it kept on being á
procrastinated.
When I got the scholarship letter from Australia.
When going to the exam.
[ When I do not get any co-operation from my friends/partners.]
When my brother's visa for the U.S.A got cancelled.

When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in á
the family after 19 years of baby boys.

When our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondary á
school who beat us up.

When my room-mate locked up the keys of my room in our room after á
I had told her that I was  only in the bathroom having a shower. á
 She left and I had to do without supper.

When I received the news that my beloved grandmother had died.  I á
was at the boarding school and was only 13 years old.

One evening when a boy who was drunk made a pass at me by trying á
to kiss me.

I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a á
great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the á
large number of pupils who fail.

During the last academic year i.e 1983/1984 just before the á
closure, we were surrounded and threatened by the paramilitary á
forces.
When someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.

When a close friend of mine who was with me in first year could á
not make it to the second year.
When one of my friends started misbehaving.

After waiting impatiently for the results of the form 5 á
examinations for almost a year, at last I received a letter of á
acceptance from the Senate of the university of Zambia telling á
me that I had made it to the first year course at UNZA.

The first day that I was close to a dead body, in my third year á
at UNZA, school of medicine.

A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad á
manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their á
telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.
When I got to know that my father had passed away.

I was disgusted to discover that my girlfriend of few weeks was á
already fooling around with another guy.  I was disappointed as á
the guy was a rogue and I respected my girlfriend.

When I received the first year results as the first year had á
involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the á
results.
When mother was very ill, I feared that she would die.

When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I á
was stopped from punching him for it.

When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was á
the first time that I lost a brother.

When a student accused me of having stolen his textbook  as he á
had found a form bearing my name in his other books and all my á
explanations fell on deaf ears.

The computer at school had left out my name along with four á
others and I had no rights for one year.  So I was happy to find á
my name on the medical schhol list.

We were driving on a very dusty road at night and the driver á
tried to overtake a very big truck only to find another big truck á
parked right in front.

I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving á
me any thing - money to come back to school.
I remember being sad whe my aunt's child died (2 days old).

I was eating in the dinning hall and some women joined me.  I á
could not eat with them so I left the dinning hall.

I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no á
visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card á
and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was á
working now.

A friend gave me a lift and we met a road-block.  He tried  to á
turn back when an officer shouted at us to stop.  My friend took a á
turn suddenly and the officer raised his gun but by the time we á
were gone.

I had worked very hard during my vacations to raise some money á
for a few major items (e.g a radio).  but when I arrived at the á
inter-city bus terminal, my hard earned money had been stolen á
from me.

My younger brother and sister were involved in an accident on á
their way back from school and my brother was quite badly hurt.

I went to the shopping centre to buy something and saw packets of á
Kapenta  with maggots in them. Oh !

When my girl and I decided to get back together after our á

English papers are due on Friday. They are returned on Tuesday. á

Achieving my goal at a swim meet. I worked toward the goal for 9 á

Housesitting and hearing the alarm go off. I knew someone had to á

Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had a á

Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and á

Seeing a friend "making love" to a high school girl. I á

It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the á

When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at the á

I was supposed to be studying for my math midterm a few days ago, á
